title: S Club 7 in talks to perform together for first time in years for 20-year reunion

The original S Club 7 line up are in talks to reunite for their 20th anniversary, Mirror Online can reveal.

Rachel Stevens, Jo O'Meara, Hannah Spearritt, Tina Barrett, Bradley McIntosh, Jon Lee and Paul Cattermole released their debut single Bring It All Back in 1999.

And now that the band is officially 20 years old, they're thinking about celebrating with an area tour.

A source close to the band told us: "There is talks in between band members now about doing a reunion arena tour next year.

"A lot of the bandmates are up for it. It's still early days but they are talking and fans may be in for a treat in 2020. It all makes perfect sense for a reunion celebrating 20 years of S Club 7."

The band, famous for hits Reach and Never Had A Dream Come True, were formed by Simon Fuller in 1998.

The music manager once said he came up with the concept for the band the day after he was fired by the Spice Girls in 1997.

They first rose to fame with their children's TV show Miami 7 and went on to top the charts in the UK.

(Image: Press Association)

Paul quit the band in 2002, saying it was time for him to "move on", and the band split a year later.

Since then, some members have continued to perform together as S Club 3 or S Club Party.

But now, they could all reunite on stage for the first time in years.

Rachel has hinted at a reunion before.

(Image: Wenn)

Speaking on This Morning earlier this year, she said: "You never know. There’s seven of us all in different stages of our lives but it does bubble up every now and then.

"I can’t believe it’s been 20 years, it’s crazy. We were all over the place. TV shows, albums, touring."
